context: Tests whether the agent follows the blog-writer skill's complete pipeline when producing a blog post from a transcript: correct file naming, TLDR format and placement, opening hook, placeholder conventions, author bio, series continuity, word count target, and voice maintenance in technical sections.

checklist.name: Research bank naming
checklist.description: A file named blog-research-production-confessions-ep2.md exists in the working directory (uses the slug provided in the task)

checklist.name: Research bank structure
checklist.description: The research bank file contains at least sections for Source Material Summary and Editorial Plan (may also include Product Context, Clarification Log, Draft Notes)

checklist.name: Draft file naming
checklist.description: A file named blog-draft-production-confessions-ep2.md exists in the working directory

checklist.name: TLDR is bullets
checklist.description: The draft contains a TLDR section that uses bullet points (lines starting with - or *), NOT prose paragraphs

checklist.name: TLDR bullet count
checklist.description: The TLDR contains exactly 2, 3, or 4 bullet items (not 1, not 5+)

checklist.name: TLDR placed before body
checklist.description: The TLDR section appears before the opening hook/story, not after the body or at the end of the post

checklist.name: TLDR recurring character last
checklist.description: One TLDR bullet mentions or quotes Lin (the recurring character), and that bullet is the last one in the TLDR list

checklist.name: Opening is narrative
checklist.description: The first section after TLDR opens with a story, anecdote, or confession -- NOT a thesis statement and NOT a preamble like 'In this post we will explore'

checklist.name: Placeholder independent numbering
checklist.description: Screenshot placeholders and Code placeholders each start their own numbering at 01 independently (e.g., Screenshot 01 and Code 01 can both exist, NOT Screenshot 01 then Code 02)

checklist.name: Placeholder zero-padding
checklist.description: All placeholders use zero-padded numbers (01, 02, etc.) not bare single digits (1, 2, etc.)

checklist.name: Code VERIFY comment
checklist.description: At least one code placeholder or inline code block includes a VERIFY comment (e.g., <!-- VERIFY: ... -->) indicating the code was reconstructed from the transcript

checklist.name: Bio post-specific kicker
checklist.description: The draft ends with an author bio for Ravi Patel that includes a rotating kicker (final sentence) referencing something specific from THIS post (e.g., silent failures, CSV exports, cgroup v2, green dashboards)

checklist.name: Series callback present
checklist.description: The draft references at least one element from the series tracker's Episode 1 (e.g., 'the autoscaler incident', 'let me check the dashboard', or Lin's 'we tried that in 2019' catchphrase)

checklist.name: Word count range
checklist.description: The blog post body (excluding the author bio section) contains between 1,500 and 2,200 words

checklist.name: No preamble announcement
checklist.description: The draft does NOT contain phrases like 'In this post, we will', 'Let's explore', 'What follows is', or 'Let's take a look at'

checklist.name: Voice in technical sections
checklist.description: At least one code block, configuration example, or technical explanation is introduced with personality (humor, opinion, or a device from the voice profile) rather than a clinical description like 'The following code shows' or 'Here is the configuration'

checklist.name: Narrative density maintained
checklist.description: At least one section in the technical middle of the post (not the opening hook, not the closing) contains a specific moment with dialogue, a reaction, or a concrete detail -- not just abstract technical summary
